column4: I have two hard drives. One with Ubuntu, the slave drive, and the master drive with Windows. I used to be able to select which OS to run when I booted up my computer, but today I reinstalled Windows, and I can't access Ubuntu at all. It's like I've only got one hard drive.
That guide tells me to enter commands. Where?
Oh, I tried the first one. Hold on.
An Ubuntu ( or any other Linux ) LiveCD
No, that only gives you a menu if you have grub installed, which you do not
Are you booted into the LiveCD?
You probably just want to do the "quick start"
finding my boot partition. I'm not quite sure what a boot partition is.
It's the partition Ubuntu is installed on
If it's on it's own hard drive, does that mean the drive is the partition?
You have windows and Ubuntu installed on the same drive, correct?
Then it is the first partition on whatever drive Ubuntu is installed on
